storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications of schedule changes to stay informed of updates

testCases.title: Validate display of schedule change notifications
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one scheduled shift in the system
Schedule change event database is accessible
API endpoint GET /api/notifications is operational
Browser supports real-time updates

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule dashboard

steps.action: Verify the schedule dashboard loads completely
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard is displayed with all components loaded within 2 seconds, including notification area

steps.action: Trigger a schedule change event (modify an existing shift time for the logged-in employee)
steps.expectedResult: A new notification appears on the dashboard in real-time without requiring page refresh, displaying details of the schedule change

steps.action: Verify notification content and visibility
steps.expectedResult: Notification is prominently displayed with clear information about the schedule change (shift date, time, type of change)

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button on the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to acknowledged and the notification is removed from the active notification list

steps.action: Verify the notification counter updates
steps.expectedResult: Active notification count decreases by one

postconditions: Notification is marked as acknowledged in the database
Notification is moved to archived notifications
Employee remains logged in on the schedule dashboard
No active notifications are displayed for the acknowledged change

testCases.title: Verify notification history accessibility
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
At least one notification has been previously acknowledged by the employee
Notification history database contains archived notifications
API endpoint for notification history is operational
Employee has permission to access notification history

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule dashboard

steps.action: Verify the schedule dashboard loads completely
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard is displayed with all navigation options visible

steps.action: Locate and click on the notification history section or link
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the notification history page

steps.action: Verify archived notifications are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All previously acknowledged notifications are displayed in chronological order with complete details (date, time, change type, acknowledgment timestamp)

steps.action: Verify notification history loads within performance requirements
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page loads within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify only employee-specific notifications are shown
steps.expectedResult: Only notifications belonging to the logged-in employee are displayed in the history

postconditions: Notification history remains accessible for future reference
No changes are made to notification statuses
Employee can navigate back to the main dashboard

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to acknowledge schedule notifications to confirm I have seen updates

testCases.title: Validate notification acknowledgment process
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
At least one unacknowledged schedule change notification exists for the employee
API endpoint POST /api/notifications/acknowledge is operational
Employee has active session and is logged in
Notification history feature is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule dashboard

steps.action: Verify schedule dashboard displays with active notifications
steps.expectedResult: Schedule dashboard is displayed with at least one unacknowledged notification visible in the notification area

steps.action: Note the notification details (content, timestamp) and the current count of active notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are clearly visible and notification count is displayed

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button on the notification
steps.expectedResult: System processes the acknowledgment request within 1 second and displays a confirmation indicator

steps.action: Verify notification status updates immediately
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to acknowledged and the notification is removed from the active notification list without page refresh

steps.action: Verify the active notification count decreases
steps.expectedResult: Active notification counter decreases by one

steps.action: Navigate to the notification history section
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page is displayed

steps.action: Verify the acknowledged notification appears in history
steps.expectedResult: The previously acknowledged notification is listed in archived notifications with acknowledgment timestamp and status marked as acknowledged

steps.action: Verify notification details match the original notification
steps.expectedResult: All notification details (content, original timestamp, schedule change information) match the original notification

postconditions: Notification status is updated to acknowledged in the database
Notification is removed from active notifications list
Notification is archived and accessible in notification history
Employee remains logged in on the dashboard
No duplicate notifications exist for the same change

testCases.title: Verify acknowledgment access control
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A has at least one unacknowledged notification
Employee B is logged into the system
API endpoint POST /api/notifications/acknowledge has proper authorization checks
Security controls are enabled for notification ownership validation

steps.action: Log in as Employee B using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee B is successfully authenticated and redirected to their schedule dashboard

steps.action: Verify Employee B's dashboard loads with their own notifications
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only notifications belonging to Employee B

steps.action: Obtain the notification ID of an unacknowledged notification belonging to Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Notification ID for Employee A's notification is identified

steps.action: Attempt to acknowledge Employee A's notification using Employee B's session (via direct API call or URL manipulation)
steps.expectedResult: System denies the acknowledgment action

steps.action: Verify error message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: System displays an appropriate error message indicating insufficient permissions or unauthorized access (e.g., 'You do not have permission to acknowledge this notification' or 'Access Denied')

steps.action: Verify Employee A's notification status remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's notification remains in unacknowledged state and is still visible in Employee A's active notifications

steps.action: Verify no changes were made to Employee B's notification list
steps.expectedResult: Employee B's notification list remains unchanged and does not include Employee A's notification

steps.action: Log out Employee B and log in as Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Employee A successfully logs in and sees their dashboard

steps.action: Verify Employee A's notification is still unacknowledged
steps.expectedResult: The notification that Employee B attempted to acknowledge is still present in Employee A's active notification list with unacknowledged status

postconditions: No unauthorized changes were made to the notification database
Security audit log records the unauthorized access attempt
Employee B's session remains active and unaffected
System security controls are validated as functioning correctly
